title: Derby’s Take: In Balance-Sheet Debate, Pay Closest Attention to the Hawks
body:
In the Federal Reserve’s struggle to contain surging inflation in a rapidly expanding economy, shrugging off the most hawkish of central bank officials can be a mistake.
The Fed’s hawks—those most inclined toward boosting borrowing costs to achieve the central bank’s job and inflation goals—in recent months made comments that telegraphed where the institution ended up going recently.
